text: Alice H. Martin (born 1955/56) is an American politician and lawyer. In 2015, she became the Chief Deputy Attorney General of Alabama. Martin was the United States Attorney for the Northern District of Alabama from 2001 until 2009. She was nominated by President George W. Bush in 2001. During her term the office established a healthcare fraud task force. The task force collected about $750M in settlements. It also obtained over 125 convictions of elected and appointed officials and contractors in public corruption prosecutions. In 2017, Martin served as the acting Attorney General of Alabama for two days. ==References== Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Politicians from Mississippi Category:Politicians from Alabama Category:Living people Category:1950s births Category:Lawyers from Mississippi Category:Lawyers from Alabama Category:United States Attorneys
title: Alice Martin
